TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PointAnimationUsingPath extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.PointAnimationBase

Docs.summary: Animates the value of a property between two or more target values using a to specify those values. This animation can be used to move a visual object along a path.

remarks.format:
## Remarks PointAnimationUsingPath uses linear interpolation over a specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration%2A>.
PointAnimationUsingPath is particularly well suited for animating the position of an object on the screen if the object uses a <xref:System.Windows.Point> property to specify position.

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks There is no default <xref:System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry> so the user must specify one.

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable clone of this , making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
Docs.returns: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.value: A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was

MemberSignature.Value: protected override System.Windows.Point GetCurrentValueCore (System.Windows.Point defaultOriginValue, System.Windows.Point defaultDestinationValue, System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock);

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Windows.Point GetCurrentValueCore(valuetype System.Windows.Point defaultOriginValue, valuetype System.Windows.Point defaultDestinationValue, class System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock) cil managed

Docs.param: The suggested origin value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set start value.
The suggested destination value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set end value.
An that generates the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress%2A> used by the animation.
Docs.summary: Calculates a value that represents the current value of the property being animated, as determined by the .
Docs.returns: The calculated value of the property, as determined by the current animation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the `defaultOriginValue` is the first in the composition chain, this value will be the snapshot value (if one is available) or the base property value; otherwise this value will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain with an <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock> that is not <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.Stopped%2A>.
The `defaultDestinationValue` is the base value if the animation is in the first composition layer of animations on a property; otherwise the value is the output value from the previous composition layer of animations for the property.

Docs.value: The calculated value of the property, as determined by the current animation.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the animation's output value is added to the base value of the property being animated.
Docs.value: **true** if the animation adds its output value to the base value of the property being animated instead of replacing it; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier Field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|None| > [!NOTE] > This dependency property is unusual in that the identifier field for it comes from , and is shared by various derived classes.

Docs.returns: **true** if the animation adds its output value to the base value of the property being animated instead of replacing it; otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the animation's value accumulates when it repeats.
Docs.value: **true** if the animation accumulates its values when its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior%2A> property causes it to repeat its simple duration. otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this property is set to **true**, the animation's output values only accumulate when the animation's property causes it to repeat its simple duration. It does not accumulate its values when it restarts because its parent repeated or because its clock was restarted from a call. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| > [!NOTE] > This dependency property is unusual in that the identifier field for it comes from , and is shared by various derived classes.

Docs.returns: **true** if the animation accumulates its values when its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior%2A> property causes it to repeat its simple duration. otherwise, **false**. The default value is **false**.

Docs.value: The path used to generate this animation's output values. The default value is **null**.
